verbs.description: magnetize (third-person singular simple present magnetizes, present participle magnetizing, simple past and past participle magnetized)

examples: Lisette let him alone, it is dangerous to push the poor creature to extremities, Doctor, suppose we Magnetize him?

entries.meaning: (figurative, transitive) To attract, allure or entice; to captivate or entrance.
examples: As for Dudley Venner, no beauty in all the world could have so soothed and magnetized him as the very repose and subdued gentleness which the Widow had thought would make the best possible background for her own more salient and effective attractions.
